Document awareness

This procedure must be read by all employees of the Community Kitchen. It is made available to volunteers for information.

IMPORTANT

Issues from previous shift → AM/PM Check + inform Kitchen Manager. Ensure cleaning products never run out.

Responsibility

Cleaning may be carried out by cooks or volunteers. Cooks are responsible for cleaning even when assisted by volunteers. Kitchen Manager provides daily oversight. Operations Manager holds overall accountability.

Cleaning products — use only

  • Detergent / degreaser (daily cleaning).
  • Food-safe disinfectant (respect dosage & contact time).
  • Clean water (rinse if required).
  • NOT allowed: non food-safe, industrial or personal products.

General rules

Do

  • Clean food areas first, floors & bins last.
  • Clean → disinfect → rinse (if required).
  • Wash hands before & after cleaning.
  • Clean spills immediately.
  • Leave surfaces clean & dry.
  • Cool leftovers → seal → date → fridge/freezer.
  • Wash dirty cloths, aprons and hats regularly.

Do not

  • Do not clean floors or bins before worktops.
  • Do not reuse the same cloth for tables & floors.
  • Do not use dirty cloths, aprons or hats.
  • Do not leave dirty equipment overnight.
  • Do not leave leftovers in the kitchen.
  • Do not leave cleaning products on worktops, near stove or utensils.

Daily — end of AM & PM shifts

Do

  • Wash all utensils & containers (pots, pans, lids, boards, dish boxes, buckets, rice cooker bowls, cutting boards, knives & knife box).
  • Clean & disinfect tables, sinks, stove, splashbacks.
  • Clean oven trays if used; rice cooker exterior if splashed.
  • Empty & clean dishwasher.
  • Sweep & mop floors.
  • Empty & clean bins.
  • Remove expired or mouldy products immediately.
  • Wash/dry dirty cloths, aprons and hats used during the shift.
  • Put cleaning products in cleaning cupboard.
  • Put work clothes in designated closet.
  • Check for signs of pests (insects, rodents).
  • Check that all the brooms are clean and that the mop buckets are empty and clean.
  • Check that everything is tidy in the cleaning room.

Note: Clean ovens with clean cloth.

Do not

  • Do not assume previous shift cleaned enough.
  • Do not leave dirty equipment overnight.
  • Do not skip cleaning or pest checks at end of shift.

Weekly

Do

  • Deep clean plastic boards.
  • Clean fridge/freezer shelves & handles.
  • Clean cupboards, doors, switches.
  • Deep clean ovens.
  • Sweep & mop pantry, hallway and Walker hall.
  • Clean exhaust hood filters and accessible surfaces.
  • Clean fridges and freezers.
  • Check pest monitoring points or traps if present.

Do not

  • Do not ignore damaged boards.
  • Do not ignore dirt or grease buildup.
  • Do not ignore pest signs or traps.

Monthly

Do

  • Defrost & deep clean freezers.
  • Clean pantry shelves.
  • Discard damaged boards.
  • Descale dishwasher.
  • Deep clean exhaust hood (including hard-to-reach areas).

Do not

  • Do not wait for heavy ice buildup.
  • Do not allow grease buildup in exhaust hood.

Recording & governance

All cleaning activities and pest checks must be recorded in the Storage and Cleaning Checks app. Daily cleaning is done after each shift (AM & PM). Weekly and monthly cleaning follow the Cleaning Schedule. Any change to the responsible person for weekly or monthly cleaning must be requested and approved by the Kitchen Manager or Operations Manager.

Inspection readiness

This procedure forms part of the AFSCA self-control system and is available at all times.
